example.translation: ‘My cousin took my betelnut. –No, it wasn’t he who took it.’

example.translation: ‘A man with long breath (=big lungs) will spear many fish, a man with short breath will not.’

example.label: ex:6:x1120
example.translation: ‘Some fish there are many, some not.’

example.label: ex:6:x1121
example.translation: ‘Will you stop that habit or not?’

example.label: ex:6:x1122
example.translation: ‘Have you seen my wife or not?’

example.label: ex:6:x1124
example.translation: ‘They put medicine in him but no (=with no result).’

example.label: ex:6:x1126
example.translation: ‘They were thus watching him (but) no (he did not revive).’

example.label: ex:6:x1123
example.translation: ‘Yesterday we ate and ate, (but) no (=we could not finish the food), our stomachs were full and we put half of it aside.’

example.label: ex:6:x1125
example.translation: ‘But no, others said, “Why take him to the village?” ’

example.label: ex:6:x1131
example.translation: ‘He did not say that he wouldn’t send (lit: say about not sending) his son.’

example.label: ex:6:x1132
example.translation: ‘We/They did not lack money.’

example.label: ex:6:x1133
example.translation: ‘I have no tobacco.’ ‘Don’t say you don’t have any.’

example.label: ex:6:x1134
example.translation: ‘No, we did not burn it.’

example.label: ex:6:x1135
example.translation: ‘We did not burn it.’

example.label: ex:6:x1152
example.translation: ‘We did not hear it.’

example.label: ex:6:x1136
example.translation: ‘I did not see it.’

example.label: ex:6:x1137
example.translation: ‘Do not laugh, grandfather is sick.’

example.label: ex:6:x1138
example.translation: ‘But I did not come and get you.’

example.label: ex:6:x1140
example.translation: ‘They did not come back and sell food again.’

example.label: ex:6:x1156
example.translation: ‘They did not know Tok Pisin well and talked to us in their own language.’

example.label: ex:6:x1763
example.translation: ‘Lazy men, not having grown and (still) being young, take wives.’

example.label: ex:6:x1153
example.translation: ‘They came back again, but did not sell any food.’

example.label: ex:6:x1139
example.translation: ‘Many people do not know him and do not follow him.’

example.label: ex:6:x1262
example.translation: ‘Alright, let’s (dl) go up to the village. We’ll visit father and mother, let’s (dl) see them in the village.’

example.label: ex:6:x1269
example.translation: ‘Later the Japanese will come and take all of you many women [here in this village].’

example.label: ex:6:x1273
example.translation: ‘Come and take this betelnut and eat it, (and) drink this coconut water.’

example.label: ex:6:x1274
example.translation: ‘I escorted them up here and went (back) again.’

example.label: ex:6:x1275
example.translation: ‘Ah, father’s lime is here, you try it and see.’

example.label: ex:6:x1278
example.translation: ‘Tomorrow I’ll come to you.’ (Lit: ‘…I’ll go (from my present place) ...’)

example.label: ex:6:x1279
example.translation: ‘If you find the men, bring them here.’

example.label: ex:6:x1892
example.translation: ‘And they came and landed at Numbia.’

example.label: ex:6:x1277
example.translation: ‘When the spirit woman went (away), he came to the/his village.’

example.label: ex:6:x1893
example.translation: ‘Yesterday we talked, now/today we talk and tomorrow we’ll talk again.’

example.label: ex:6:x1268
example.translation: ‘They pulled carts for them, after they had told the men one by one.’

example.label: ex:6:x1941
example.translation: ‘We have been doing like that (all the time) up until now.’

example.label: ex:6:x1942
example.translation: ‘You will be like that (long time) but next year you will talk.’

example.label: ex:6:x1889
example.translation: ‘…we will go down tomorrow, we will go down to fetch sea water.’

example.label: ex:6:x475
example.translation: ‘It fell with a thud (and they knew that) now the water had dried up.’

example.label: ex:6:x1891
example.translation: ‘They came and came, and just now many came up there in Wewak.’

example.label: ex:6:x1284
example.translation: ‘First they look at the pig(s) in the village.’

example.label: ex:6:x1285
example.translation: ‘That was like that too, the (guilty) person/people did not appear.’

example.label: ex:6:x1286
example.translation: ‘There is a place for putting two more engines.’

example.label: ex:6:x1308
example.translation: ‘Three piglets came.’

example.label: ex:6:x1287
example.translation: ‘All the women went and fished at the river.’

example.label: ex:6:x1288
example.translation: ‘That is the men’s custom, the custom of burying wife/wives.’

example.label: ex:6:x1289
example.translation: ‘When the fighting was finished, alright the Simbine people fled.’

example.label: ex:6:x1290
example.translation: ‘We butchered the pig and cooked the pieces like that.’

example.label: ex:6:x1291
example.translation: ‘The village headmen harvest it first, not common people like this/us.’

example.label: ex:6:x1292
example.translation: ‘I and my father are here.’

example.label: ex:6:x1293
example.translation: ‘Later when you and your husband fight, don’t come to me.’

example.label: ex:6:x1309
example.translation: ‘She went and looked for anyone/people but no, she did not sense (there was) anyone (there).’

example.label: ex:6:x1296
example.translation: ‘They came and landed there at Numbia.’

example.label: ex:6:x1283
example.translation: ‘American fighter planes came and went on dropping bombs there in Ulingan. They were really high up and went like this to Wewak.’

example.label: ex:6:x1298
example.translation: ‘They butchered the cow and cut it into small pieces and cooked it/them.’

example.label: ex:6:x1297
example.translation: ‘They hit him all over and tore his trousers to pieces.’

example.label: ex:6:x1300
example.translation: ‘Many planes are descending here.’

example.label: ex:6:x1299
example.translation: ‘Also many houses burned down when the ammunition burned them.’

example.label: ex:6:x1302
example.translation: ‘Earlier he had received ornaments from all of them and (now) he put them on his own body only.’

example.label: ex:6:x1303
example.translation: ‘We’ll follow/obey the talk of the middle-aged men.’

example.label: ex:6:x1304
example.translation: ‘They gave him big meat (tin) cases for free.’

example.label: ex:6:x1305
example.translation: ‘Breathe deeply twice.’

example.label: ex:6:x1306
example.translation: ‘First they tried it three times on top.’

example.label: ex:6:x1336
example.translation: ‘This stilt is long but the other one is longer (lit: very long).’

example.label: ex:6:x1324
example.translation: ‘I climbed a high mountain, but you climbed a higher (lit: very high) mountain.’

example.label: ex:6:x1325
example.translation: ‘That pig is smaller than the other one.’ Or: ‘That other pig is bigger than that one.’ (Lit: That pig is small, the other one is big.)’

example.label: ex:6:x1326
example.translation: ‘My father’s work is better than this other man’s. (Lit: My father’s work is good, this other man’s is not.) ’

example.label: ex:6:x1327
example.translation: ‘They are big things, greater than these.’

example.label: ex:6:x1328
example.translation: ‘Do you want to become greater than our ancestors?’

example.label: ex:6:x1333
example.translation: ‘This piece of timber is short, I cut the other one longer.’

example.label: ex:6:x1329
example.translation: ‘He is stronger than I. (Lit: His strength surpasses my strength.)’

example.label: ex:6:x1894
example.translation: ‘Someone else is more intelligent than I. (Lit: …surpasses my head/knowledge.)’

example.label: ex:6:x1895
example.translation: ‘… we’ll not go up earlier than they, no.’

example.label: ex:6:x1337
example.translation: ‘This stilt is longer than that one, and/but that other one is the longest.’

example.label: ex:6:x1334
example.translation: ‘They heard a different voice and ran away.’

example.label: ex:6:x1335
example.translation: ‘Don’t tell different things to the youngsters (from what you are supposed to tell them).’

example.label: ex:6:x1331
example.translation: ‘Your feet are big, just as big as my feet.’ Or: ‘Your big feet are just as big as mine.’

example.label: ex:6:x1332
example.translation: ‘The hole (is) as deep as Moro village is long.’

example.label: ex:6:x1338
example.translation: ‘The father is big, (and) the son is like that too.’

example.label: ex:6:x1339
example.translation: ‘The boy/son is like his father.’

example.label: ex:6:x1348
example.translation: ‘Give us food like that.’

example.label: ex:6:x1347
example.translation: ‘On nights like this they pulled the carts.’

example.label: ex:6:x1341
example.translation: ‘Turtle meat is good, like chicken meat.’

example.label: ex:6:x1340
example.translation: ‘An eel is like a snake.’

example.label: ex:6:x1342
example.translation: ‘Ulingan – wow – the airplanes were like birds, there were lots of them.’

example.label: ex:6:x1343
example.translation: ‘Why did you bring us down here as if you knew the road?’

example.label: ex:6:x1344
example.translation: ‘He split coconuts (for copra), as if he were going to Manam.’

example.label: ex:6:x1345
example.translation: ‘I worked hard for nothing, as if they would pay me for it (lit: buy me).’

example.label: ex:6:x1346
example.translation: ‘The girl’s face is exactly like her mother’s.’

example.label: ex:7:x1167
example.translation: ‘Who is building a house?’

example.label: ex:7:x1166
example.translation: ‘What will the son eat?’

example.label: ex:7:x1164
example.translation: ‘How many children (lit. son daughter) do you have?’

example.label: ex:7:x1165
example.translation: ‘Why should we take the body to the village?’

example.label: ex:7:x1378
example.translation: ‘How could we extinguish the fire that was burning?’

example.label: ex:7:x1173
example.translation: ‘Where (lit: in which place) will that thing appear?’

example.label: ex:7:x1174
example.translation: ‘The men of which village danced?’

example.label: ex:7:x1168
example.translation: ‘Who hit them (so that) they ran away?’

example.label: ex:7:x1175
example.translation: ‘At what time did they say to go?’

example.label: ex:7:x1177
example.translation: ‘Who (woman) came at what time?’

example.label: ex:7:x1178
example.translation: ‘Which man took/married which woman?’

example.label: ex:7:x1187
example.translation: ‘(I wonder) what will happen to me because father scolded me?’

example.label: ex:7:x1179
example.translation: ‘Didn’t you see that?’

example.label: ex:7:x1180
example.translation: ‘You?’

example.label: ex:7:x1181
example.translation: ‘Is that thing good?’

example.label: ex:7:x1182
example.translation: ‘Did you see my wife or not?’

example.label: ex:7:x1183
example.translation: ‘Do you remember (lit: push the liver) that, or have you forgotten (lit: liver is stuck) it?’

example.label: ex:7:x1184
example.translation: ‘Will you go to Matukar, Dylup, or Sarang?’

example.label: ex:7:x1185
example.translation: ‘Will you go to Matukar or Dylup (or perhaps neither)?’

example.label: ex:7:x1186
example.translation: ‘Did you light a fire or did you feel (that there was) a man?’

example.label: ex:7:x1350
example.translation: ‘Did they bring food, or what?’

example.label: ex:7:x1351
example.translation: ‘He was watching whether it would rot or what would happen.’

example.label: ex:7:x1189
example.translation: ‘A: Big brother is going to Goroka. B: Is he going to Goroka?’

example.label: ex:7:x1190
example.translation: ‘Who did he tell?’

example.label: ex:7:x1191
example.translation: ‘Who did he tell???’

example.label: ex:7:x1192
example.translation: ‘Are you asking who he told?’

example.label: ex:7:x1188
example.translation: ‘Do you believe about me that I can heal you, is that so?’

example.label: ex:7:x1205
example.translation: ‘Where would we have that kind of money to give you? (=We do not have money to give you.)’

example.label: ex:7:x1206
example.translation: ‘Will I be with you forever? (= I will not.)’

example.label: ex:7:x1202
example.translation: ‘Why are you crying like that? (=You should not cry like that.)’

example.label: ex:7:x1207
example.translation: ‘Who told you to come? (=You shouldn’t have come)’

example.label: ex:7:x1208
example.translation: ‘Oh son, why did you do this to us?’

example.label: ex:7:x1209
example.translation: ‘Have you seen my “little rat” (pig) that went down to the valley? (implying: I have no doubt that you have stolen my pig.)’

example.label: ex:7:x1355
example.translation: ‘What is the reason why you never come up quickly?’

example.label: ex:7:x1216
example.translation: ‘Are you going to town tomorrow?’

example.label: ex:7:x1217
example.translation: ‘Yes.’

example.label: ex:7:x1218
example.translation: ‘(Yes,) I am going.’

example.label: ex:7:x1220
example.translation: ‘(No,) I am not going.’

example.label: ex:7:x1219
example.translation: ‘(Yes,) I’ll go to town tomorrow.’

example.label: ex:7:x1221
example.translation: ‘What kind of food did you eat?’

example.label: ex:7:x1222
example.translation: ‘(We ate) the white people’s food.’

example.label: ex:7:x1223
example.translation: ‘What did your nephew do to you?’

example.label: ex:7:x1224
example.translation: ‘I worked but he did not even look at me.’ (Implying: Your presupposition is wrong; he did not do anything indecent to me.)

example.label: ex:7:x1117
example.translation: ‘Didn’t father come? –Yes (he did).’

example.label: ex:7:x1118
example.translation: ‘Didn’t father come? –No (he didn’t).’

example.label: ex:7:x1072
example.translation: ‘Run(pl.) to Medebur, flee.’

example.label: ex:7:x1075
example.translation: ‘Fool, don’t say like that.’

example.label: ex:7:x1074
example.translation: ‘Stop crying, please!’

example.label: ex:7:x1076
example.translation: ‘Tell us about your catching a turtle, and we’ll listen.’ (Or: ‘You will tell us about your catching a turtle and we’ll listen.’)

example.label: ex:7:x1084
example.translation: ‘Bring it!’

example.label: ex:7:x1082
example.translation: ‘Women, go to the garden, look for food and come down.’

example.label: ex:7:x1364
example.translation: ‘Tell the people and let them not eat me.’

example.label: ex:7:x1846
example.translation: ‘Having been here with him (=your brother), go up to your husband again.’

example.label: ex:7:x1157
example.translation: ‘Alright, let’s go down to the village.’

example.label: ex:7:x1158
example.translation: ‘Let’s go and see them.’

example.label: ex:7:x1159
example.translation: ‘Let her not talk to her brothers.’

example.label: ex:7:x1160
example.translation: ‘Let her with her husband keep going, seeing him and coming back.’

example.label: ex:7:x1896
example.translation: ‘Keep doing like that.’

example.label: ex:7:x1161
example.translation: ‘Now do that.’

example.label: ex:7:x1162
example.translation: ‘Don’t have/keep your eyes closed.’

example.label: ex:7:x1080
example.translation: ‘Don’t lie!’

example.label: ex:7:x1081
example.translation: ‘Say like that and wail.’

example.label: ex:8:x1352
example.translation: ‘I didn’t take the betelnut, why do you accuse me?’

example.label: ex:8:x1358
example.translation: ‘(You) go to dance, I don’t want to.’

example.label: ex:8:x1897
example.translation: ‘Those (many) of you, who have stayed inland, arrive (back in your villages)!’

example.label: ex:8:x1362
example.translation: ‘You are telling me to go where?’

example.label: ex:8:x1366
example.translation: ‘Mother, get us sugarcane and we will eat it.’

example.label: ex:8:x1367
example.translation: ‘The Japanese didn’t have any wives, (they were) just the men.’

example.label: ex:8:x1390
example.translation: ‘Kuuten’s father was the firstborn (son), my father was the lastborn.’

example.label: ex:8:x1391
example.translation: ‘We father’s side of the family (lit: loincloth) go first, you are mother’s side (lit: grass skirt).’

example.label: ex:8:x1368
example.translation: ‘Saying so, they became many flying foxes, they became birds of paradise, they flew (away).’

example.label: ex:8:x1392
example.translation: ‘Alright we tie one end of the cane to the trap, the other to a (piece of) bamboo.’

example.label: ex:8:x1851
example.translation: ‘You see me from the house and/as I will go and come.’

example.label: ex:8:x1370
example.translation: ‘We’ll visit my parents, let’s see them in the village.’

example.label: ex:8:x1369
example.translation: ‘The truck broke and while they were fixing the truck it became dark, (then) it was midnight.’

example.label: ex:8:x1371
example.translation: ‘They looked for the medical orderly, and when they found him and told him, he went ahead of them.’

example.label: ex:8:x1404
example.translation: ‘Also, the pig was not big, (so) it was not enough for many people.’

example.label: ex:8:x1425
example.translation: ‘Don’t eat this eel, (because) it is a spirit man.’

example.label: ex:8:x1372
example.translation: ‘We didn’t sense anyone there and we ourselves did not hold fire either.’

example.label: ex:8:x1374
example.translation: ‘We didn’t see the men who burned it, we didn’t sense them and we didn’t find them.’

example.label: ex:8:x1375
example.translation: ‘We placed the pots, spears and bamboo water containers in line in front of the house, but many ran away.’

example.label: ex:8:x1376
example.translation: ‘It was getting light, and spirits came and carried the boy with his bed (away) on their shoulders.’

example.label: ex:8:x1377
example.translation: ‘Long ago, the parents of a boy cooked food in the afternoon, (but) perhaps they did not put any food for him …’

example.label: ex:8:x1379
example.translation: ‘I help you Malala people with your work, and I help my village, Moro village.’

example.label: ex:8:x1380
example.translation: ‘Eema came and told us, and the bald man himself too came and told us.’

example.label: ex:8:x1385
example.translation: ‘That is about people becoming sick or dying, you foresaw (in a dream) that some man became sick.’

example.label: ex:8:x1386
example.translation: ‘Later when you come, will you here leave that habit or not?’

example.label: ex:8:x1384
example.translation: ‘When we see some man’s face in a dream we say, “Has some other man become sick or died (or possibly neither)?” ’

example.label: ex:8:x1388
example.translation: ‘That time Kedem was very scared but Yoli wasn’t.’

example.label: ex:8:x1395
example.translation: ‘As for the old woman, they (aready) ate the meal earlier but did not give (any of it) to her to eat.’

example.label: ex:8:x728
example.translation: ‘Bombs kept dropping in front of my house. But I didn’t keep running away.’

example.label: ex:8:x1389
example.translation: ‘We eat fish soup, but we don’t eat shellfish, (and) we don’t eat pork.’

example.label: ex:8:x1394
example.translation: ‘We walked there, but we did not hold/have any fire.’

example.label: ex:8:x1396
example.translation: ‘We who walked there didn’t hold/have any fire.’ (Or: ‘When we walked there, we didn’t hold/have any fire.’)

example.label: ex:8:x1400
example.translation: ‘Friend, it was you who pitied me and killed this iguana, therefore you roast and eat this iguana.’

example.label: ex:8:x1401
example.translation: ‘The houses do not have many windows, so those who sleep (there) do not sense/feel the cold too much.’

example.label: ex:8:x1402
example.translation: ‘Pita’s grandfather died, so he (Pita) didn’t go to school.’

example.label: ex:8:x1408
example.translation: ‘You yourself do bad things like that too, therefore you too will be under accusation.’

example.label: ex:8:x1403
example.translation: ‘They were walking there in that place and came down, and so the guilt (for starting a forest fire) stuck to them.’

example.label: ex:8:x1407
example.translation: ‘So therefore do not follow the behavior of those who follow/believe in spirits.’

example.label: ex:8:x1410
example.translation: ‘You are hard-headed, therefore you do not like to change your (bad) ways.’

example.label: ex:8:x1411
example.translation: ‘You do (bad) things like that. Therefore the talk that he already said about you is very accurate.’

example.label: ex:8:x1904
example.translation: ‘This group put down ten kina. Therefore that group put down ten kina, too.’

example.label: ex:8:x1409
example.translation: ‘Christ received a lot of pain, so we all too get (pain) like that.’

example.label: ex:8:x1905
example.translation: ‘Therefore they asked, “So then, who are you?” ’

example.label: ex:8:x1424
example.translation: ‘(Since it is the case that) those three are enough and came up, so then why did I have to come up? (or: …so then I came up in vain).’

example.label: ex:8:x1417
example.translation: ‘There is no forest near the village, because we have planted a lot of coconut palms.’

example.label: ex:8:x1420
example.translation: ‘We saw Poh San and were relieved (lit: liver fell), because we had thought that (her) sickness hadn’t healed yet (but it had).’

example.label: ex:8:x1906
example.translation: ‘…they got a lot of money. (That’s) because they sold good food.’

example.label: ex:8:x1421
example.translation: ‘That time I did not work in the village, because I thought that I was due to go up to Ukarumpa, and (so) I didn’t like to work.’

example.label: ex:8:x1422
example.translation: ‘We didn’t walk in many places, because the village/town was big, therefore we didn’t care to walk.’

example.label: ex:8:x1423
example.translation: ‘We do not give wives to lazy men, because when the woman bears a child what would it eat, therefore we do not give wives to lazy men.’

example.label: ex:8:x1426
example.translation: ‘Watch out, otherwise/lest you get cheated.’

example.label: ex:8:x1427
example.translation: ‘We must not do like that, otherwise/lest we break our custom/law (or: … lest we ourselves break the custom/law).’

example.label: ex:8:x1485
example.translation: ‘They ate it themselves, spread mud on the plates and brought them up to the village.’

example.label: ex:8:x1486
example.translation: ‘Later we (by) ourselves will come up and tell you (to come), and when you come down we will sit here together and eat a little bit of soup and then you can walk back.’

example.label: ex:8:x1449
example.translation: ‘Two weeks were finished, and did you (then) come to the village?’

example.label: ex:8:x1452
example.translation: ‘Shall I do like that and kill her?’ (Or: ‘Is it in that way that I shall kill her?’)

example.label: ex:8:x1451
example.translation: ‘What did you do (so that) this sickness came to you?’

example.label: ex:8:x1450
example.translation: ‘You ran and where did you go?’

example.label: ex:8:x1443
example.translation: ‘They did not come back and sell food.’

example.label: ex:8:x1447
example.translation: ‘While going, don’t turn and look back, just keep paddling.’

example.label: ex:8:x1446
example.translation: ‘When the Japanese were coming up the Australians saw them and ran away and/but did not tell us.’

example.label: ex:8:x1448
example.translation: ‘Earlier our (fore)fathers didn’t understand this custom, and (so) they adopted (lit: got/took) children indiscriminately.’

example.label: ex:8:x1464
example.translation: ‘Alright, the war was getting close and they dismissed my husband and he came to the village, after he had been a soldier.’

example.label: ex:8:x1465
example.translation: ‘They drive (lit: put) them to the shallow water and the fish ascend to the beach and (then) some are speared by men with a fishing spear.’

example.label: ex:8:x1466
example.translation: ‘We went and fetched coconut water.’

example.label: ex:8:x1467
example.translation: ‘I took a knife and cut (into) the leg. (Or: I cut into the leg with a knife.’)

example.label: ex:8:x1468
example.translation: ‘It (=a pig) died and I took a rope and tied its legs two and two together and pushed it to a carrying pole and carried it down on my shoulder.’

example.label: ex:8:x1471
example.translation: ‘They went down and saw them like that, the people’s bones, teeth and heads turning white.’

example.label: ex:8:x1469
example.translation: ‘It keeps burning and many men follow the kunai grass fire, having taken spears.’

example.label: ex:8:x1470
example.translation: ‘We eat one joint of sugarcane, when/after our mothers have gotten it for us from the garden.’

example.label: ex:8:x1431
example.translation: ‘Turn around, go and tell the village men and let them come up and extinguish the fire.’

example.label: ex:8:x1433
example.translation: ‘He came and married me.’

example.label: ex:8:x1437
example.translation: ‘We eat, take the trap, wrap taro, take the the trap frame and spear(s) and go to the kunai grass area.’

example.label: ex:8:x1442
example.translation: ‘He cut a long stick, came and killed the snake.’

example.label: ex:8:x1444
example.translation: ‘Men husk them (coconuts) and put them there and fetch a truck, and the truck takes the dry coconuts and brings them close to the drying shed (lit: fire house), and we split them.’

example.label: ex:8:x1445
example.translation: ‘Later when you become a man and take a wife, what will you do?’

example.label: ex:8:x1502
